tabitems.js

Summary
tabitems.js
TabItemAn Item that represents a tab.
Functions
toStringPrints [TabItem (tab)] for debug use
forceCanvasSizeRepaints the thumbnail with the given resolution, and forces it to stay that resolution until unforceCanvasSize is called.
unforceCanvasSizeStops holding the thumbnail resolution; allows it to shift to the size of thumbnail on screen.
isShowingCachedDataReturns a boolean indicates whether the cached data is being displayed or not.
showCachedDataShows the cached data i.e.
hideCachedDataHides the cached data i.e.
getStorageDataGet data to be used for persistent storage of this object.
saveStore persistent for this object.
_reconnectLoad the reciever’s persistent data from storage.
setHiddenHide/unhide this item
getHiddenReturn hide state of item
setBoundsMoves this item to the specified location and size.
setZSets the z-index for this item.
closeCloses this item (actually closes the tab associated with it, which automatically closes the item.
addClassAdds the specified CSS class to this item’s container DOM element.
removeClassRemoves the specified CSS class from this item’s container DOM element.
setResizableIf value is true, makes this item resizable, otherwise non-resizable.
makeActiveUpdates this item to visually indicate that it’s active.
makeDeactiveUpdates this item to visually indicate that it’s not active.
zoomInAllows you to select the tab and zoom in on it, thereby bringing you to the tab in Firefox to interact with.
zoomOutHandles the zoom down animation after returning to TabView.
getZoomTransformReturns the transform function which represents the maximum bounds of the tab thumbnail in the zoom animation.
TabItemsSingleton for managing TabItems
Functions
toStringPrints [TabItems count=count] for debug use
initSet up the necessary tracking to maintain the TabItemss.
uninit
fragmentReturn a DocumentFragment which has a single <div> child.
isCompleteReturn whether the xul:tab has fully loaded.
updateTakes in a xul:tab.
_updateTakes in a xul:tab.
shouldLoadFavIconTakes a xul:browser and checks whether we should display a favicon for it.
linkTakes in a xul:tab, creates a TabItem for it and adds it to the scene.
unlinkTakes in a xul:tab and destroys the TabItem associated with it.
startHeartbeatStart a new heartbeat if there isn’t one already started.
_checkHeartbeatThis periodically checks for tabs waiting to be updated, and calls _update on them.
pausePaintingTells TabItems to stop updating thumbnails (so you can do animations without thumbnail paints causing stutters).
resumePaintingUndoes a call to pausePainting.
isPaintingPausedReturns a boolean indicating whether painting is paused or not.
pauseReconnectingDon’t reconnect any new tabs until resume is called.
resumeReconnectingReconnect all of the tabs that were created since we paused.
reconnectingPausedReturns true if reconnecting is paused.
registerAdds the given TabItem to the master list.
unregisterRemoves the given TabItem from the master list.
getItemsReturns a copy of the master array of TabItems.
saveAllSaves all open TabItems.
storageSanityChecks the specified data (as returned by TabItem.getStorageData or loaded from storage) and returns true if it looks valid.
getFontSizeFromWidthPrivate method that returns the fontsize to use given the tab’s width
_getWidthForHeightPrivate method that returns the tabitem width given a height.
_getHeightForWidthPrivate method that returns the tabitem height given a width.
calcValidSizePass in a desired size, and receive a size based on proper title size and aspect ratio.
TabPriorityQueueContainer that returns tab items in a priority order Current implementation assigns tab to either a high priority or low priority queue, and toggles which queue items are popped from.
Functions
toStringPrints [TabPriorityQueue count=count] for debug use
clearEmpty the update queue
hasItemsReturn whether pending items exist
getItemsReturns all queued items, ordered from low to high priority
pushAdd an item to be prioritized
popRemove and return the next item in priority order
peekReturn the next item in priority order, without removing it
removeRemove the passed item
TabCanvasTakes care of the actual canvas for the tab thumbnail Does not need to be accessed from outside of tabitems.js
Functions
toStringPrints [TabCanvas (tab)] for debug use
paint
_fillCanvasBackgroundDraws a rectangle of <width>x<height> with color <bgColor> to the given canvas context.
_drawWindowDraws contents of the tabs’ browser window to the given canvas context.
_calculateClippingRectCalculate the clipping rect that will be projected to the tab’s thumbnail canvas.
toImageData

TabItem

An Item that represents a tab.  Also implements the <Subscribable> interface.

Parameters

taba xul:tab
Summary
Functions
toStringPrints [TabItem (tab)] for debug use
forceCanvasSizeRepaints the thumbnail with the given resolution, and forces it to stay that resolution until unforceCanvasSize is called.
unforceCanvasSizeStops holding the thumbnail resolution; allows it to shift to the size of thumbnail on screen.
isShowingCachedDataReturns a boolean indicates whether the cached data is being displayed or not.
showCachedDataShows the cached data i.e.
hideCachedDataHides the cached data i.e.
getStorageDataGet data to be used for persistent storage of this object.
saveStore persistent for this object.
_reconnectLoad the reciever’s persistent data from storage.
setHiddenHide/unhide this item
getHiddenReturn hide state of item
setBoundsMoves this item to the specified location and size.
setZSets the z-index for this item.
closeCloses this item (actually closes the tab associated with it, which automatically closes the item.
addClassAdds the specified CSS class to this item’s container DOM element.
removeClassRemoves the specified CSS class from this item’s container DOM element.
setResizableIf value is true, makes this item resizable, otherwise non-resizable.
makeActiveUpdates this item to visually indicate that it’s active.
makeDeactiveUpdates this item to visually indicate that it’s not active.
zoomInAllows you to select the tab and zoom in on it, thereby bringing you to the tab in Firefox to interact with.
zoomOutHandles the zoom down animation after returning to TabView.
getZoomTransformReturns the transform function which represents the maximum bounds of the tab thumbnail in the zoom animation.

Functions

toString

toString: function TabItem_toString()

Prints [TabItem (tab)] for debug use

forceCanvasSize

forceCanvasSize: function TabItem_forceCanvasSize(w,
h)

Repaints the thumbnail with the given resolution, and forces it to stay that resolution until unforceCanvasSize is called.

unforceCanvasSize

unforceCanvasSize: function TabItem_unforceCanvasSize()

Stops holding the thumbnail resolution; allows it to shift to the size of thumbnail on screen.  Note that this call does not nest, unlike TabItems.resumePainting; if you call forceCanvasSize multiple times, you just need a single unforce to clear them all.

isShowingCachedData

isShowingCachedData: function()

Returns a boolean indicates whether the cached data is being displayed or not.

showCachedData

showCachedData: function TabItem_showCachedData(tabData)

Shows the cached data i.e. image and title.  Note: this method should only be called at browser startup with the cached data avaliable.

Parameters

tabDatathe tab data

hideCachedData

hideCachedData: function TabItem_hideCachedData()

Hides the cached data i.e. image and title and show the canvas.

getStorageData

getStorageData: function TabItem_getStorageData(getImageData)

Get data to be used for persistent storage of this object.

Parameters

getImageDatatrue to include thumbnail pixels (and page title as well); default false

save

save: function TabItem_save(saveImageData)

Store persistent for this object.

Parameters

saveImageDatatrue to include thumbnail pixels (and page title as well); default false

_reconnect

_reconnect: function TabItem__reconnect()

Load the reciever’s persistent data from storage.  If there is none, treats it as a new tab.

setHidden

setHidden: function TabItem_setHidden(val)

Hide/unhide this item

getHidden

getHidden: function TabItem_getHidden()

Return hide state of item

setBounds

setBounds: function TabItem_setBounds(inRect,
immediately,
options)

Moves this item to the specified location and size.

Parameters

recta <Rect> giving the new bounds
immediatelytrue if it should not animate; default false
optionsan object with additional parameters, see below

Possible options

forcetrue to always update the DOM even if the bounds haven’t changed; default false

setZ

setZ: function TabItem_setZ(value)

Sets the z-index for this item.

close

close: function TabItem_close(groupClose)

Closes this item (actually closes the tab associated with it, which automatically closes the item.  Parameters: groupClose - true if this method is called by group close action.  Returns true if this tab is removed.

addClass

addClass: function TabItem_addClass(className)

Adds the specified CSS class to this item’s container DOM element.

removeClass

removeClass: function TabItem_removeClass(className)

Removes the specified CSS class from this item’s container DOM element.

setResizable

setResizable: function TabItem_setResizable(value,
immediately)

If value is true, makes this item resizable, otherwise non-resizable.  Shows/hides a visible resize handle as appropriate.

makeActive

makeActive: function TabItem_makeActive()

Updates this item to visually indicate that it’s active.

makeDeactive

makeDeactive: function TabItem_makeDeactive()

Updates this item to visually indicate that it’s not active.

zoomIn

zoomIn: function TabItem_zoomIn(isNewBlankTab)

Allows you to select the tab and zoom in on it, thereby bringing you to the tab in Firefox to interact with.  Parameters: isNewBlankTab - boolean indicates whether it is a newly opened blank tab.

zoomOut

zoomOut: function TabItem_zoomOut(complete)

Handles the zoom down animation after returning to TabView.  It is expected that this routine will be called from the chrome thread

Parameters

completea function to call after the zoom down animation

getZoomTransform

getZoomTransform: function TabItem_getZoomTransform(scaleCheat)

Returns the transform function which represents the maximum bounds of the tab thumbnail in the zoom animation.

TabItems

Singleton for managing TabItems

Summary
Functions
toStringPrints [TabItems count=count] for debug use
initSet up the necessary tracking to maintain the TabItemss.
uninit
fragmentReturn a DocumentFragment which has a single <div> child.
isCompleteReturn whether the xul:tab has fully loaded.
updateTakes in a xul:tab.
_updateTakes in a xul:tab.

unlinkTakes in a xul:tab and destroys the TabItem associated with it.

_checkHeartbeatThis periodically checks for tabs waiting to be updated, and calls _update on them.
pausePaintingTells TabItems to stop updating thumbnails (so you can do animations without thumbnail paints causing stutters).

isPaintingPausedReturns a boolean indicating whether painting is paused or not.
pauseReconnectingDon’t reconnect any new tabs until resume is called.
resumeReconnectingReconnect all of the tabs that were created since we paused.
reconnectingPausedReturns true if reconnecting is paused.

getFontSizeFromWidthPrivate method that returns the fontsize to use given the tab’s width
_getWidthForHeightPrivate method that returns the tabitem width given a height.
_getHeightForWidthPrivate method that returns the tabitem height given a width.
calcValidSizePass in a desired size, and receive a size based on proper title size and aspect ratio.

Functions

toString

toString: function TabItems_toString()

Prints [TabItems count=count] for debug use

init

init: function TabItems_init()

Set up the necessary tracking to maintain the TabItemss.

uninit

uninit: function TabItems_uninit()

fragment

fragment: function TabItems_fragment()

Return a DocumentFragment which has a single <div> child.  This child node will act as a template for all TabItem containers.  The first call of this function caches the DocumentFragment in _fragment.

isComplete

isComplete: function TabItems_update(tab)

Return whether the xul:tab has fully loaded.

update

update: function TabItems_update(tab)

Takes in a xul:tab.

_update

_update: function TabItems__update(tab,
options)

Takes in a xul:tab.

Parameters

taba xul tab to update
optionsan object with additional parameters, see below

Possible options

forcetrue to always update the tab item even if it’s incomplete

shouldLoadFavIcon

shouldLoadFavIcon: function TabItems_shouldLoadFavIcon(browser)

Takes a xul:browser and checks whether we should display a favicon for it.

link

link: function TabItems_link(tab,
options)

Takes in a xul:tab, creates a TabItem for it and adds it to the scene.

unlink

unlink: function TabItems_unlink(tab)

Takes in a xul:tab and destroys the TabItem associated with it.

startHeartbeat

startHeartbeat: function TabItems_startHeartbeat()

Start a new heartbeat if there isn’t one already started.  The heartbeat is a chain of setTimeout calls that allows us to spread out update calls over a period of time.  _heartbeat is used to make sure that we don’t add multiple setTimeout chains.

_checkHeartbeat

_checkHeartbeat: function TabItems__checkHeartbeat()

This periodically checks for tabs waiting to be updated, and calls _update on them.  Should only be called by startHeartbeat and resumePainting.

pausePainting

pausePainting: function TabItems_pausePainting()

Tells TabItems to stop updating thumbnails (so you can do animations without thumbnail paints causing stutters). pausePainting can be called multiple times, but every call to pausePainting needs to be mirrored with a call to resumePainting.

resumePainting

resumePainting: function TabItems_resumePainting()

Undoes a call to pausePainting.  For instance, if you called pausePainting three times in a row, you’ll need to call resumePainting three times before TabItems will start updating thumbnails again.

isPaintingPaused

isPaintingPaused: function TabItems_isPaintingPaused()

Returns a boolean indicating whether painting is paused or not.

pauseReconnecting

pauseReconnecting: function TabItems_pauseReconnecting()

Don’t reconnect any new tabs until resume is called.

resumeReconnecting

resumeReconnecting: function TabItems_resumeReconnecting()

Reconnect all of the tabs that were created since we paused.

reconnectingPaused

reconnectingPaused: function TabItems_reconnectingPaused()

Returns true if reconnecting is paused.

register

register: function TabItems_register(item)

Adds the given TabItem to the master list.

unregister

unregister: function TabItems_unregister(item)

Removes the given TabItem from the master list.

getItems

getItems: function TabItems_getItems()

Returns a copy of the master array of TabItems.

saveAll

saveAll: function TabItems_saveAll(saveImageData)

Saves all open TabItems.

Parameters

saveImageDatatrue to include thumbnail pixels (and page title as well); default false

storageSanity

storageSanity: function TabItems_storageSanity(data)

Checks the specified data (as returned by TabItem.getStorageData or loaded from storage) and returns true if it looks valid.  TODO: check everything

getFontSizeFromWidth

getFontSizeFromWidth: function TabItem_getFontSizeFromWidth(width)

Private method that returns the fontsize to use given the tab’s width

_getWidthForHeight

_getWidthForHeight: function TabItems__getWidthForHeight(height)

Private method that returns the tabitem width given a height.

_getHeightForWidth

_getHeightForWidth: function TabItems__getHeightForWidth(width)

Private method that returns the tabitem height given a width.

calcValidSize

calcValidSize: function TabItems_calcValidSize(size,
options)

Pass in a desired size, and receive a size based on proper title size and aspect ratio.

TabPriorityQueue

Container that returns tab items in a priority order Current implementation assigns tab to either a high priority or low priority queue, and toggles which queue items are popped from.  This guarantees that high priority items which are constantly being added will not eclipse changes for lower priority items.

Summary
Functions
toStringPrints [TabPriorityQueue count=count] for debug use
clearEmpty the update queue
hasItemsReturn whether pending items exist
getItemsReturns all queued items, ordered from low to high priority
pushAdd an item to be prioritized
popRemove and return the next item in priority order
peekReturn the next item in priority order, without removing it
removeRemove the passed item

Functions

toString

toString: function TabPriorityQueue_toString()

Prints [TabPriorityQueue count=count] for debug use

clear

clear: function TabPriorityQueue_clear()

Empty the update queue

hasItems

hasItems: function TabPriorityQueue_hasItems()

Return whether pending items exist

getItems

getItems: function TabPriorityQueue_getItems()

Returns all queued items, ordered from low to high priority

push

push: function TabPriorityQueue_push(tab)

Add an item to be prioritized

pop

pop: function TabPriorityQueue_pop()

Remove and return the next item in priority order

peek

peek: function TabPriorityQueue_peek()

Return the next item in priority order, without removing it

remove

remove: function TabPriorityQueue_remove(tab)

Remove the passed item

TabCanvas

Takes care of the actual canvas for the tab thumbnail Does not need to be accessed from outside of tabitems.js

Summary
Functions
toStringPrints [TabCanvas (tab)] for debug use
paint
_fillCanvasBackgroundDraws a rectangle of <width>x<height> with color <bgColor> to the given canvas context.
_drawWindowDraws contents of the tabs’ browser window to the given canvas context.
_calculateClippingRectCalculate the clipping rect that will be projected to the tab’s thumbnail canvas.
toImageData

Functions

toString

toString: function TabCanvas_toString()

Prints [TabCanvas (tab)] for debug use

paint

paint: function TabCanvas_paint(evt)

_fillCanvasBackground

_fillCanvasBackground: function TabCanvas__fillCanvasBackground(ctx,
width,
height,
bgColor)

Draws a rectangle of <width>x<height> with color <bgColor> to the given canvas context.

_drawWindow

_drawWindow: function TabCanvas__drawWindow(ctx,
width,
height,
bgColor)

Draws contents of the tabs’ browser window to the given canvas context.

_calculateClippingRect

_calculateClippingRect: function TabCanvas__calculateClippingRect(origWidth,
origHeight)

Calculate the clipping rect that will be projected to the tab’s thumbnail canvas.

toImageData

toImageData: function TabCanvas_toImageData()

Superclass for all visible objects (TabItems and GroupItems).
